div.head: CHAP. CXXXIII.
The benefite of the communion of Saints.
div.ab: [A song of degrees of Dauid.] Behold how good and how pleasant it is: for brethren to dwell together in vnitie. Heb. euen together.
It is like the precious oyntment vpon the head, that ranne downe vpon the beard, euen Aarons beard: that went downe to the skirts of his garments.
As the dew of Hermon, and as the dewe that descended vpon the mountaines of Zion, for there the Lord commanded the blessing: euen life for euermore.
